item.title: Bar Plots
item.description: This type of data visualiztion is my personal favorite. I hope you like learning about it too! Let’s make sure to install the proper pakages. library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) This example will look at the team homerun totals for all the MLB teams in 1980. query<-"SELECT name,HR FROM Teams WHERE yearID=1980 ORDER BY HR " result<-sqldf(query) result$name<-factor(result$name,levels=result$name) It is important to let the system know how the data should appear in, by saving the command as factor.

item.title: Time Series
item.description: Here is another cool data visualization example using a times series graph Just like the last post we have to make sure we dowload all the proper pakages and put them into library. library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) In this post we will view Babe Ruth’s homeruns over his career in baseball. query<-"SELECT yearID,HR FROM Batting WHERE playerID='ruthba01'" result<-sqldf(query) Now the best part, the graph! Again, using ggplot2 we will graph the line and points of the information we just collected, to form a time series.
